derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (first used in the sense 'eloquently expressed'): via Latin from Greek rhētorikos (from rhētor 'rhetor') + -al

entry.tran: (问题)修辞性的，反问的，反诘的
entry.def: A rhetorical question is one which is asked in order to make a statement rather than to get an answer.

example.ex: He grimaced slightly, obviously expecting no answer to his rhetorical question...
example.tran: 他微微皱了下眉头，显然并不期待任何人回答他的反问。

example.ex: He made no answer to the Commandante's question, which had been rhetorical in any case.
example.tran: 他没有回答司令官的问题，反正司令官只是反问一下。

entry.tran: (语言)夸张的，词藻华丽的，修辞的
entry.def: Rhetorical language is intended to be grand and impressive.

example.ex: These arguments may have been used as a rhetorical device to argue for a perpetuation of a United Nations role.
example.tran: 这些论据或许是用来作为一种修辞手段来论证联合国将发挥长久的作用。

sentences.sentence: "accepted two or three verbal and rhetorical changes I suggested"- W.A.White
"the rhetorical sin of the meaningless variation"- Lewis Mumford

means.word_mean: 2. concerned with effect or style of writing and speaking;

sentences.sentence: "a rhetorical question is one asked solely to produce an effect (especially to make an assertion) rather than to elicit a reply"

auth_sentence.content: These are rhetorical questions - please do not respond.
auth_sentence.res_content: These are rhetorical questions - please do not respond.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: These are rhetorical questions - please do not respond.

auth_sentence.content: His rhetorical skills sometimes got the better of him.
auth_sentence.res_content: His rhetorical skills sometimes got the better of him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His rhetorical skills sometimes got the better of him.

auth_sentence.content: His speeches are held up for their rhetorical craft.
auth_sentence.res_content: His speeches are held up for their rhetorical craft.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His speeches are held up for their rhetorical craft.

Sentence.sentence: Energy independence" and its rhetorical (修辞的) companion "energy security" are, however, slippery concepts that are rarely though through.

means.word_mean: 修辞的, 用来产生修辞效果的

sentences.en: a speech full of rhetorical flourishes
The writer showed great rhetorical skill.
sentences.cn: 该作者显示出非常出色的修辞技巧。

sentences.en: Most readers are likely to lose interest when he descends into the realms of rhetorical terminology.
sentences.cn: 他开始讨论修辞术语，大多数读者很可能会失去兴趣。

sentences.en: Her queries were rhetorical,and best ignored.
sentences.cn: 她的质问只不过是说说而已,最好不予理睬。
